com.SIMRacingApps.Util

Class FindFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SIMRacingApps.Util.FindFile

  • public class FindFile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has helper methods for finding and opening files in the user's path or classpath.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeffrey Gilliam
    Copyright:
    Copyright (C) 2015 - 2019 Jeffrey Gilliam
    License:
    Apache License 2.0

      Constructor for finding a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FindFile

        public FindFile(java.lang.String pathname)
         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructor for finding a file. It looks in the current directory, then in each directory from the user's path, then the directories in the classpath. If found, it opens an InputStream to the file, so don't forget to close it.
        Parameters:
        pathname - The path to the file found.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - When the file cannot be found.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public static FindFile find(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> pathnames)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Provided an array of names, this returns the first one found.
        Parameters:
        pathnames - An array of files to find.
        Returns:
        The file found.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - When none of the files are found.

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Returns the java.io.File object for the file that was found. It may not be able to do certain things if the file is found in a jar.
        Returns:
        The File object.

      • getUserDocumentsPath

        public static java.lang.String getUserDocumentsPath()
        Returns the path to the users Documents location.
        Returns:
        The path to the user's documents location.

      • getUserPath

        public static java.lang.String[] getUserPath()
        Returns an array of the user's paths. If the user has not set their own path, then the users "My Documents" location will be used to create a SIMRacingApps folder.
        Returns:
        An array of the user's paths.

      • setUserPath

        public static void setUserPath(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the user's paths by parsing the "path" argument for semicolon as a separator. If the path is null or empty, it will not change the existing path. If the path is relative, then it will be created in the user's documents folder.
        Parameters:
        path - A semicolon separated list of directories to use as the user's path.

      • getFileFound

        public java.lang.String getFileFound()
        Returns the name of the file that was found including the path to where it was found. If found in the classpath, the original name is returned.
        Returns:
        Then name of the file found.

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Returns the InputStream of the file.
        Returns:
        The InputStream or null of not found

      • getBufferedInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getBufferedInputStream()
        Returns the BufferedInputStream of the file.
        Returns:
        The BufferedInputStream or null of not found

      • getURL

        public java.net.URL getURL()
        Returns a URL to the found file.
        Returns:
        The URL to the file.

      • copy

        public static void copy(FindFile src,
                        java.io.File dest)
        Copies the src file to the dest file.
        Parameters:
        src - The source FindFile instance
        dest - The dest filename

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.InputStream is,
                        java.io.File src,
                        java.io.File dest)

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the InputStream.

              throws java.lang.Throwable

        Throws:

      • getJSON

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getJSON()
        Returns the contents of the file parsed as a JSON file as a Map<String,Object> type. To detect a file not found, the map will be empty.
        Returns:
        The Map<String,Object> instance of the parsed JSON file.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
